message: a race car is safer than a street car? Well there's a shock. Race cars are built with full roll cages, special seats, special seat belts, Hans devices and (most importantly) the driver wears a helmet. Vehicle deaths in the street would drop dramatically if helmets were made mandatory in road cars. But let's be honest, that will never happen. But again, watch the video and tell me how much safer cars used to be.

message: : polls are in line with just about everyone else's.....however, I will agree that none of the """"cable"""" news sources are 100% honest in anything. In fact last I checked Fox lies & misinforms 67% of the time. lies & misinforms 46% of the time. CNN lies & misinforms 18% of the time....and NONE are under the typical journalistic standards of scrutiny because they are all classified as """"entertainment"""" not news.....I personally like to fact-check everything through other sources but do enjoy starting with the entertainment as a base.

message: Messing with the an ecosystem that has taken hundreds of thousands of years to develop = DISASTER!!! drastic change makes for drastic knock on effects. In 1945 Australia introduced the cane toad to help control the cane beetle and stop them eating the sugar canes. 70 years on they are still spreading across the country poisoning predators and out eating the native frogs insect base. This was over looked at the time of introduction....perhaps there might be something we are over looking here.
